metadata.title: CVE-2022-31779 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper Input Validation vulnerability in HTTP/2 header parsing of ApacheTraffic Server allows an attacker to smuggle requests. This issue affectsApache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 9.1.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 9.1.3+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 9.1.3+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.3+ds-1').
